title: January 2018 Android Security Bulletin Partner Preview

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the parseURL function of URLStreamHandler, there is improper input validation of the host field. This could lead to a remote elevation of privilege that could enable bypassing user interaction requirements.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change host parsing to match the WHATWG URL parsing algorithm, checking the final '@' instead of the first.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several functions of libhevc, NEON registers are not preserved. This could lead to remote code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to preserve the NEON registers, as required by the ARM ABI calling conventions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the initDecoder function of SoftAVCDec, there is an possible out-of-bounds write to mCodecCtx due to a use after free when buffer allocation fails. This could lead to remote code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the failure code from ivdec_api_function before accessing mCodecCtx to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_allocate_static_bufs and ihevcd_create functions of SoftHEVC, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a use after free. Both ps_codec_obj and ps_create_op->s_ivd_create_op_t.pv_handle point to the same memory and ps_codec_obj could be freed without clearing ps_create_op->s_ivd_create_op_t.pv_handle. This could lead to remote code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check for success before accessing mCodecCtx in SoftHEVC::initDecoder to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the onQueueFilled function of SoftAVCDec, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a use after free if a bad header causes the decoder to get caught in a loop while another thread frees the memory it's accessing. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to exit onQueueFilled if the bad header is detected, rather than getting caught in an infinite loop.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the doGetThumb and getThumbnail functions of MtpServer, there is a possible double free due to not NULLing out a freed pointer. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to NULL out the freed pointer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the sendFormatChange function of ACodec, there is a possible integer overflow which could lead to an out-of-bounds write. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the enableVSyncInjections function of SurfaceFlinger, there is a possible use after free of mVSyncInjector. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make vsync injections more robust against use after frees.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In MPEG4Extractor.cpp, there are several places where functions return early without cleaning up internal buffers which could lead to memory leaks. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to address the memory leaks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_decode function of ihevcd_decode.c, there is an infinite loop due to an incomplete frame error. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the incomplete frame error.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_parse_slice_header function of ihevcd_parse_slice_header.c a slice address of zero after the first slice could result in an infinite loop. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to improve handling when the slice address is zero and it isn't the first slice in the pic.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ihevcd_decode.c there is a possible infinite loop due to bytes for an sps of unsupported resolution resulting in the same sps being fed in over and over. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to consume bytes for sps with unsupported resolution in order to prevent the infinite loop.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_parse_sps function of ihevcd_parse_headers.c, several parameter values could be negative which could lead to negative indexes which could lead to an infinite loop. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to return an error for negative crop parameters.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places in ihevcd_decode.c, a dead loop could occur due to incomplete frames which could lead to memory leaks. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to address incomplete frame errors.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_parse_slice.c function, slave threads are not joined if there is an error. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to always rejoin slave threads and to not parse the bitstream in slice error mode.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In Bitmap.ccp if Bitmap.nativeCreate fails an out of memory exception is not thrown leading to a java.io.IOException later on. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to throw an out of memory exception.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In receive_packet of libnetutils/packet.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check on the DHCP response. This could lead to remote code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ServiceManager::add function in the hardware service manager, there is an insecure permissions check based on the PID of the caller which could allow an application or service to replace a HAL service with its own service. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to get the selinux context of the caller sooner and fix the behavior of HIDL interfaces.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In CameraDeviceClient::submitRequestList of CameraDeviceClient.cpp, there is an out-of-bounds write if metadataSize is too small. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bta_scan_results_cb_impl of btif_ble_scanner.cc, there is possible resource exhaustion if a large number of repeated BLE scan results are received. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the equal_to function in btif_ble_scanner.cc, allowing repeated entries to be skipped.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several functions of MediaPlayerService, there is a possible use after free due to insufficient locking around the mPlayer member. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locks around access to mPlayer and mAudioOutput.
vulnerabilities.notes: This fix was originally released in the September 2017 partner preview security bulletin.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the hardware HEVC decoder, some media files could cause a page fault. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the page fault.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In tpacket_rcv of net/packet/af_packet.c, there is an out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to a local elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent calling virtio_net_hdr_from_skb if it is not safe.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In skcipher_recvmsg of crypto/algif_skcipher.c, there is an out-of-bounds write due to a double free. This could lead to a local elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to reorder operations to prevent the double free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ashmem_ioctl of ashmem.c, there is an out-of-bounds write due to insufficient locking when accessing asma. This could lead to a local elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking around access to asma.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Access to CNTVCT_EL0 could be used for side channel attacks. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to restrict access to those high performance timers.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In DisplayFtmItem in the bootloader, there is an out-of-bounds write due to reading a string without verifying that it's null-terminated. This could lead to secure boot bypass and a local elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the out-of-bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the OMXNodeInstance::useBuffer and IOMX::freeBuffer functions, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition if the user frees the buffer while it's being used in another thread. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a flag to indicate whether the client buffer is available to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a possible heap buffer overflow in libMtkOmxVdec.so. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: An integer overflow in the NVIDIA driver could cause a use after free. This could lead to an elevation of privilege enabling code execution as a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to adjust gem reference count properly to avoid the issue.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is an use after free issue in qualcomm display driver, leading to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper validations.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a heap buffer overflow in the bootloader code reading the SafeSwitch image.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a size check before reading the image.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several functions of ClipboardService.java, there is possible local access to protected data (e.g., if the phone receives an SMS message while on the lock screen and the user pastes the clipboard contents into the response) due to a missing check. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make clipboard contents unavailable while the phone is locked.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the AesCtrDecryptor::decrypt function of AesCtrDecryptor.cpp there is no check whether the size of the key is actually 16 bytes. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that the key is equal to 16 bytes in length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the Reverb_setParameter function in EffectReverb.cpp there is a no check that vsize is greater than or equal to sizeof(unit16_t), which could lead to an out-of-bounds read if a vsize of 0 is passed in. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that vsize is greater than or equal to sizeof(unit16_t).

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In GetInvInt of fixpoint_math.h memory can be accessed outside the intCount array which could lead to an out-of-bounds read. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In MPEG4Writer::Track::getCodecSpecificDataFromInputFormatIfPossible in MPEG4Writer.cpp there is a use after free due to a variable going out of scope being used. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to move the copy operation into scope in order to eliminate the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevc_inter_pred_luma_horz_a9q function of ihevc_inter_pred_filters_luma_horz.s, there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to an error in the ctbs. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to set error skip ctbs in order to avoid the out-of-bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_nal_unit function of ihevcd_nal.c there is a possible out-of-bounds read. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to move the decision to signal missing ctbs to the end of the current slice hdr parsing in order to prevent out-of-bounds read errors.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the lppTransposer function of lpp_tran.cpp there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to a loop that goes too long. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize the whole bwBorders array to a reasonable value to guarantee correct termination of the while loop to prevent the out-of-bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264d_api.c there are missing bounds checks that can could cause an out-of-bounds read when parsing a sei_message. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to increase allocation and added checks in sei parsing.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264d_fill_bs1_16x16mb_pslice in ih264d_compute_bs.c there is a missing bounds check which could lead to an out-of-bounds read. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to re-initialize NMB group and other variables of the decoder context when Mbaff flag changes.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In impeg2d_dec_pic_hdr in impeg2d_dec_hdr.c there is a missing bounds check which can lead to an out-of-bounds read. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that f_code parameters are within the spec [1,7].

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the removeUnsynchronizationV2_4 function of ID3.cpp an out-of-bounds read could occur due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to information disclosure
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the bounds of the buffer before copying its data.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ih264d_assign_pic_num function of ih264d_utils.c there is a possible null pointer dereference. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add an extra structure to read mmco values, to check for null, and to copy data only once per picture.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264d_api.c there is a null check missing which could occur when a memory allocation fails. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to handle dec_hdl memory allocation failure gracefully.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the ihevcd_create function of ihevcd_api.c there is a missing null check which could occur when a memory allocation fails. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to handle ps_codec_obj memory allocation failure gracefully.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the copy_and_extend_plane function of extend.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds read as part of a memcpy due to a mistake in calculating storage sizes for odd frame widths. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the error in calculating storage sizes for odd frame widths.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the copyLine function of FrameSequence_gif.cpp a null pointer dereference could occur. This could lead to denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to skip composition of frames lacking a color map in order to avoid the null pointer dereference.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In UsbDebuggingActivity of UsbDebuggingActivity.java, it could be possible for an app to cover the permission dialog and convince the user to grant it debugging permissions without their knowledge. This could lead to an elevation of privilege that could enable bypassing user interaction requirements.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent clicks on the button in the debugging dialog from being accepted if the dialog is obscured.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wl_cfgvendor_set_bssid_blacklist of wl_cfgvendor.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to a local elevation of privilege enabling arbitrary code execution.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In UpdatePartitionAttributes of PartitionTableUpdate.c, there is an integer overflow that could lead to an out-of-bounds write. This could lead to a local elevation of privilege enabling arbitrary code execution.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Through the /sys/devices/soc/7577000.i2c/i2c-3/3-0020/input/input3/rmidev/data device of the Synaptics Touchscreen controller, it is possible to write to a number of touchscreen registers.  This could lead to denial of service.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to restrict access to this device.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In hidp_connection_add of net/bluetooth/hidp/sock.c, there is an out-of-bounds write. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove BlueZ support from the device configurations.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a stack buffer overflow issue in the function wls_parse_batching_cmd of the Pixel C wireless driver, leading to a possible escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use the correct buffer size when calling sscanf.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is an out-of-bounds write issue in the function mp_override_legacy_irq if an out-of-bounds bus_irq is provided, leading to a possible escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add validation against invalid “bus_irq” values.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is an out-of-bounds read issue in the function find_new_capacity leading to a general bypass of kernel level defense in depth measures.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: The move_pages system call in mm/migrate.c in the Linux kernel before 4.12.9 doesn't check the effective uid of the target process, resulting in possible information disclosure. This could enable a local attacker to learn the memory layout of a setuid executable despite ASLR.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform the right checks to avoid information disclosure.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: The x86/fpu (Floating Point Unit) subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.13.5, does not correctly handle attempts to set reserved bits in the xstate header via the ptrace() or rt_sigreturn() system call. This could lead to information disclosure, allowing local users to read the FPU registers of other processes on the system, related to arch/x86/kernel/fpu/regset.c and arch/x86/kernel/fpu/signal.c.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a proper check against invalid user-supplied values and avoid the information disclosure.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: An overly permissive SELinux policy could allow a compromised Mediatek modem chip using the ccci_fsd driver to write arbitrary files to the system permission.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the unnecessary permissions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a double free issue in G-link driver caused by concurrent rx notifications, leading to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a race condition in function spcom_handle_write calling spcom_create_channel_chardev leading to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locking mechanism to avoid race conditions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a buffer overflow issue in fastrpc kernel driver, leading to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a out-of-bounds write in stack buffer in function hdd_parse_setrmcenable_command, causing an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use correct buffer size in sscanf function.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a buffer overflow issue in WLAN cal data store operation when a negative size argument is provided by user, leading to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use unsigned variable type.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a TOCTOU issue in In the pp_pgc_get_config() graphics driver function, causing kernel memory overflow, leading to an elevation of privilege  in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use copy_from_user for accessing user supplied parameters.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: A buffer overflow could potentially occur in the function sme_SetFTIEs due to incorrect initialization of the WEXT callback and also when invoked from csrRoamIssueFTPreauthReq due to a lack of a maximum boundary check for ft_ies_length.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a check for set_ft_ies buffer length in args of ioctl WLAN_PRIV_SET_FTIE, and ensure ft_ies_length does not exceed MAX_FTIE_SIZE in sme_SetFTIEs.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the function 'update_firmware_image', 'flash_read' reads data from flash into RAM without checking that the data fits into allocated RAM size.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the update_firmware_image function.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: A specially-crafted HDMI CEC message can be used to cause stack memory corruption. In the function cec_receive_message(), the stack variable "event" is vulnerable to a buffer overflow as there is no check on "event.cec.length."
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a length check on event.cec.length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a vulnerability in __ipa_mdfy_rt_rule where an invalid value returned from ip_id_find can still be used, leading to out-of-bounds reads and writes in kernel memory.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use the correct pointer as returned from ip_id_find.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While processing a user supplied sparse image, a buffer overflow vulnerability could occur if the sparse header block size is invalid.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate user-supplied sparse image block size.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While performing an update of the FOTA partition, uninitialized data can be pushed to storage.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize the full buffer to zeros.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While flashing a UBI image with improper offsets, uninitialized memory could be accessed.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the header and offsets of the UBI image.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: The slimslave_reg_dump debugfs node allows raw register access to data coming from an always-on microphone.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove filesystem read permissions from the vulnerable debugfs node.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: If user space provides an IE length in wlan_hdd_cfg80211_set_ie, a buffer over-read could occur.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the IE length to avoid a buffer over-read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While processing a sparse image, uninitialized heap memory can potentially be flashed due to the lack of validation of sparse image block header size.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure the block size in the sparse image header is a multiple of 4.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While updating the recovery message for eMMC devices, 1088 bytes of stack memory can potentially be leaked.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that unused buffer space is initialized.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: While processing sparse image, uninitialized heap memory can potentially be flashed due to the lack of validation of sparse image block header size.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure the block size of the sparse image header is a multiple of 4.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There was a previous security update that caused issues with the keystore's handling of key upgrades. This is preventing enterprise customers for deploying Android security updates.
vulnerabilities.fix_details:
The fix is designed to address issues in keystore where it doesn’t handle key upgrade for granted keys
or keys with effective uid (keys under WiFi uid) correctly.
vulnerabilities.notes: This issue was introduced with a prior security patch and is important functionality for many Android enterprise customers, who currently have to perform an expensive manual process every month after devices receive security updates in order to work around it.
